variable.label: Output FL(f) ON in analog mode
Output FL(r) ON in analog mode
Output F 1 ON in analog mode
Output F 2 ON in analog mode
Output F 3 ON in analog mode
Output F 4 ON in analog mode
Output F 5 ON in analog mode
Output F 6 ON in analog mode
No Sound moving to stop (brake squeal)
BEMF Pull
variable.comment: Controls how much BEMF (0-no BEMF to 255-max)

variable.label: Brake Sound Trigger
variable.tooltip: CV62 rate of speed change to trigger brake noise slots 120 to 122

variable.label: Track Voltage Reference
variable.comment: 160=16v track volts, appears to be percentage in reality, 100=normal, values 1-255 are legal. Alters top speed better than CV5

variable.label: ZIMO Course influence F-L
variable.tooltip: CV96 selected speed between F L (MX9 and/or HLU) from version 52, see CV59, 60

variable.label: ZIMO Course influence L-U
variable.tooltip: CV97 selected speed between L U (MX9 and/or HLU) from version 52, see CV59, 60

variable.label: ZIMO Course influence U
variable.tooltip: CV98 selected speed between U Stop (MX9 and/or HLU) from version 52, see CV59, 60

variable.label: Strong Time
variable.tooltip: CV129 Strong reduction of sound after acceleration, Position 00-03 in Filelist

variable.label: Weak Time
variable.tooltip: CV130 Slightly reduction of sound after breaking, Position 08-11 in Filelist

variable.label: Speed Step 1 Exhaust Interval
variable.tooltip:
Time between exhausts at speed step 1, 1476/time,
range 1-65535, lower = fewer beats per second.

variable.label: CV137 Motor frequency
variable.comment: using DC Brake Momentum as feature to get this option onto Motor control pane

variable.label: Sound Loop
variable.tooltip: CV145 bitwise looping of sound slots if sound is spread over five elements, see manual

variable.label: Strong Time
variable.tooltip: CV146 Strong reduction of sound after acceleration, Position 00-03 in Filelist

variable.label: Engine FWD, Uncoupling BWD
variable.tooltip: CV152, Engine FWD, output wire for rear uncoupler, values either 1,2,3,4, or 1,2,4,8

variable.label: Engine BWD, Uncoupling FWD
variable.tooltip: CV153, Engine BWD, output wire for front uncoupler, values either 1,2,3,4, or 1,2,4,8

variable.label: Light Effects FL(f)
variable.tooltip: CV154, Light Effects FL(f), see manual

variable.label: Light Effects FL(r)
variable.tooltip: CV155, Light Effects FL(r), see manual

variable.label: Light Effects F 1
variable.tooltip: CV156, Light Effects F 1, see manual

variable.label: Light Effects F 2
variable.tooltip: CV157, Light Effects F 2, see manual

variable.label: Light Effects F 3
variable.tooltip: CV158, Light Effects F 3, see manual

variable.label: Light Effects F 4
variable.tooltip: CV159, Light Effects F 4, see manual

variable.label: Light Effects F 5
variable.tooltip: CV160, Light Effects F 5, see manual

variable.label: Light Effects F 6
variable.tooltip: CV161, Light Effects F 6, see manual

variable.label: Diode Sensitivity
variable.tooltip: CV162, diode sensitivity for Diode Braking (suggest 10-20)

variable.label: Acceleration Sound Trigger
variable.tooltip: CV177 rate of speed change to trigger accel noise slots 123-125

label.label: Note, this pane is still work in progress.
Particularly note that strong time for SL75 is CV146, previous decoders were CV129.
Recommend care when changing settings, and take notes. Information on how this pane with
works with different decoders would be welcome.
Full speed rate, or if chuff sensor used,
divider for number of chuff pulses per wheel revolution
Low speed chuff rate (two byte number)
Strong and Weak time sets period for acceleration
and decelleration sounds to be heard

display.tooltip: CV53, acceleration noise triggered by this setting
CV56, coasting noise triggered by this setting

display.item: No Sound moving to stop (brake squeal)

label.label: Sound Frequency, alters apparent size of locomotive
Set function keys to turn on/off main sound and sound slots in Function Map
Slot Sound Levels, automatic and function key repetition rates, CV's 112, 113, 122 to 128, 145
Each slot can play randomly when standing or when moving. Set with checkboxes below.
Sounds can also be played by function key (set in function map), with repetitions and if sound
is made of five components can be made to loop for continuous sounds (see CT manuals)

display.label: Random time between sounds selected below (0.5sec)
